metadata.title: CVE-2019-19076 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: ** DISPUTED ** A memory leak in the nfp_abm_u32_knode_replace() function indrivers/net/ethernet/netronome/nfp/abm/cls.c in the Linux kernel before5.3.6 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption),aka CID-78beef629fd9. NOTE: This has been argued as not a validvulnerability. The upstream commit 78beef629fd9 was reverted.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
